resources.string: 4. Exhale slowly through your mouth, allowing your abdomen to fall naturally as you release the breath.
3. Take a slow, deep breath in through your nose, allowing your abdomen to rise as you fill your lungs with air.
2. Place one hand on your abdomen, just below your ribcage, and the other hand on your chest.
Follow these steps to practice deep belly breathing:
5. Continue this pattern of deep breathing, focusing on the gentle rise and fall of your abdomen with each breath.
1. Find a comfortable sitting or lying position.
Follow the steps to scan your body
4.Slowly move your attention up through each part of your body and Release tension with each exhale.
1.Find a comfortable and quiet space to sit or lie down.
8.Take a moment to bring your awareness to your entire body, feeling a sense of relaxation and peace.
